p: The influenza surveillance system of Korea was initiated in October 1997 with a small number of volunteer specialists in internal medicine, pediatrics, and family medicine [ 9]. This surveillance system has been extended since 2000 to the Korea Influenza Surveillance Scheme. Currently, the influenza surveillance system operated by the Korea CDC consists of clinical sentinel surveillance, laboratory sentinel surveillance (Korea Influenza and Respiratory Virus Surveillance System [KINRESS]), and influenza hospitalization and mortality surveillance systems [ 24].
